noun.description: A small wooden peg or spigot for stopping a cask.
A large, heavy timber driven into the ground to support a superstructure.

verb.description: Broach (a cask) with a peg in order to draw off liquid.

origin: Early 16th century: from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German, wooden peg; in spile (sense 2 of the noun) apparently an alteration of pile.
